page.title: 03TRADE_SHOPPING IN HEADINGLEY
page.content: ON THE 8TH MAY 1985 MY CLASS MADE A SURVEY OF THE SHOPS AT HEADINGLEY ARNDALE CENTRE.THERE WERE 26 SHOPS,OF WHICH 6 WERE FOODSHOPS,4 WERE CLOTHES-SHOPS,2 WERE STATIONERS AND 2 SOLD ELECTRICAL GOODS.THERE WAS 1 BANK AND A POST OFFICE.THE BIGGEST SHOPS WERE SAFEWAYS SUPERMARKET,WOOLWORTHS HOUSE-HOLD GOODS,AND WILKINSONS D.I.Y. FOUR SHOPS WERE VACANT AND THE BOOK SHOP WAS CLOSING DOWN.THIS IS BECAUSE THE SHOP RENTS AND RATES HAVE RISEN BY 10%.BIG SHOPS LIKE SAFEWAYS CAN AFFORD THE HIGH RATES BECAUSE THEY HAVE A LOT OF CUSTOMERS EACH DAY,BUT THE SMALLER SHOPS FIND IT DIFFICULT TO MANAGE. AMY LOWEN 9
